Just thought I would throw it out there for anyone who likes a good cold (or warm as it may be) beer. Maybe I can get some ideas on a few to try. 
 
 As a general disclaimer...please drink responsibly and do not drink and drive! I was at 2 fatal accidents last month with a total of 3 killed due to drinking and driving. The last thing anyone wants is me looking at your lifeless body saying "yep...he dead jimmy". 
 
 Personally, I really don't like hops. I tend to avoid anything that makes me pucker as hops tend to do. 
 
 Coors Light: Refreshment on hot days when I get done mowing the lawn.
 
 Budweiser: My standard beer for watching sports or going out. Good taste and not too heavy.
 
 Samuel Smith's Oatmeal Stout: Simply fantastic.
 
 Guinness: A meal in a glass.
 
 Any good unfiltered wheat beer served at about 60F.
Its actually more of a cider - but I love Strongbow.
A beer I've been drinking recently is Gulden Draak. It's definitely worth a try. But be careful as it has a 10.5% alcohol content.

Its actually more of a cider - but I love Strongbow.

 
 If I drank alcohol, I wouldn't ever touch any American or Canadian beer.
 
 I would probably drink something British like Strongbow or French Wines. I don't know. I love food and drinks, but I know absolutely nothing about alcohol. Who's up for some Bennedict Alcohol Education?

My favorite is Michelob but I also like Bud dry when I can find it. I don't like any kind of draft beer as it tends to give me headaches. I did try some Mexican beer called Carda Blanca that is really good, but in my area it's hard to find . 
 
 I only drink maybe 2 or three beers in a years time, Being diabetic I can't drink beer like I used to.. damn I miss cold beer on Sunday football games...
The Poles may have come over to the UK and stolen all our jobs but they brought Tyskie and Zywiec beers with them too;)

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Favorite Beers
